sentence.text: U U.S. Republican Party candidate , former commissioner of the (IRS), filed a complaint on Monday with the (FEC) to challenge his exclusion from Thursday's first Republican Party presidential debate. Everson argues his exclusion violates Title 11 of the in that debate hosts must not "structure the debates to promote or advance one candidate over another", and must "use pre-established objective criteria to determine which candidates may participate in a debate." Everson served as Commissioner of the IRS from 2003 to 2007, during the administration. After his departure, he briefly served as CEO of the , worked in the cabinet of Indiana , and worked for the tax consulting firm .
